page.title: 18A LOCAL FARM
page.content: SHEEPCROFT FARM Sheepcroft Farm covers 220 acres.It used to be Sheepcroft Hill Farm.The farm is along the main road to Wantage and it is bounded by streams on two sides.In very wet weather these streams are liable to flood. There is another farm opposite called Mill Farm. Sheepcroft farm grows grass for silage. It is a beef and dairy farm all in one. They feed the cows on cake and hay and for the bedding they use straw. WILD LIFE The animals which have been seen on the farm are:-fox, hare, hedgehog, rat, mole, mouse, water vole, grey squirrel, weasel and mink. The more unusual birds that have been seen are :- mallards, teal, coot, moorhen, heron, curlew, snipe, red-legged partridge, kestrel, owl, skylark and cuckoo. A lot of birds live near the brook.
